articles.headline: Overstock C.E.O. Takes Aim at ‘Deep State’ After Romance With Russian Agent
articles.snippet: Patrick Byrne said in an interview that he was still “quite fond” of Maria Butina, who is now in prison, and that she “should go home and be president of Russia one day.’’
articles.abstract: Patrick Byrne said in an interview that he was still “quite fond” of Maria Butina, who is now in prison, and that she “should go home and be president of Russia one day.’’
articles.lead_paragraph: They met at a libertarian conference in Las Vegas in July 2015, where they discussed Milton Friedman, Anton Chekhov and John Locke.

articles.headline: Push for Ethnic Studies in Schools Faces a Dilemma: Whose Stories to Tell
articles.snippet: A struggle in California, one of three states creating K-12 ethnic studies materials, highlights some of the fraught questions around the discipline.
articles.abstract: A struggle in California, one of three states creating K-12 ethnic studies materials, highlights some of the fraught questions around the discipline.
articles.lead_paragraph: Discuss a recent instance of police brutality in your community. Read op-eds arguing for and against legal status for unauthorized immigrants. Compare and contrast border conditions in the Palestinian territories and Mexico.

articles.headline: Economic Trouble Signs Hang Over Trump’s Trade War
articles.snippet: White House advisers discount warnings of a possible recession. But the president may be gambling that the Federal Reserve can ward off that prospect.
articles.abstract: White House advisers discount warnings of a possible recession. But the president may be gambling that the Federal Reserve can ward off that prospect.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Against the backdrop of mounting evidence that the global economy is weakening, President Trump is caught between his desire to pursue the trade war with China he promised to win and his need to keep the economy humming as the 2020 election approaches.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley, Jeanna Smialek and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Wells Fargo Closed Their Accounts, but the Fees Continued to Mount
articles.snippet: When the bank closes customers’ accounts, it doesn’t always mean money stops going out. That can leave customers with hefty overdraft charges.
articles.abstract: When the bank closes customers’ accounts, it doesn’t always mean money stops going out. That can leave customers with hefty overdraft charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Xavier Einaudi did not want to wait for Wells Fargo to send him a check.

articles.headline: Obama and Biden’s Relationship Looks Rosy. It Wasn’t Always That Simple.
articles.snippet: Their partnership is the stuff of buddy-movie lore, but those who saw it up close described a more difficult, complicated dynamic.
articles.abstract: Their partnership is the stuff of buddy-movie lore, but those who saw it up close described a more difficult, complicated dynamic.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Barack Obama was riding his call for generational change to the Democratic presidential nomination in the spring of 2008 when he began musing about potential running mates with aides traveling with him on the trail.

articles.headline: Tlaib Renounces Trip to West Bank Under Israel’s Conditions
articles.snippet: Israel said Ms. Tlaib could visit her grandmother in the West Bank if she agreed not to “promote boycotts.” Ms. Tlaib initially agreed then canceled.
articles.abstract: Israel said Ms. Tlaib could visit her grandmother in the West Bank if she agreed not to “promote boycotts.” Ms. Tlaib initially agreed then canceled.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israel relented slightly on Friday after barring Representative Rashida Tlaib under pressure from President Trump, and said she could visit her 90-year-old grandmother, who lives in the occupied West Bank.

articles.headline: Cathay Pacific C.E.O.’s Resignation Shows China’s Looming Power Over Hong Kong Unrest
articles.snippet: The departure of the executive, Rupert Hogg, illustrates Beijing’s influence over global companies whose bottom lines depend upon access to the mainland.
articles.abstract: The departure of the executive, Rupert Hogg, illustrates Beijing’s influence over global companies whose bottom lines depend upon access to the mainland.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The chief executive of Cathay Pacific Airways, one of Hong Kong’s best-known international brands, stepped down on Friday after a storm of criticism from the Chinese government over its employees’ participation in street protests that have seized the territory in recent months.
articles.byline: By Raymond Zhong and Ezra Cheung

articles.headline: A.I. Is Learning From Humans. Many Humans.
articles.snippet: Artificial intelligence is being taught by thousands of office workers around the world. It is not exactly futuristic work.
articles.abstract: Artificial intelligence is being taught by thousands of office workers around the world. It is not exactly futuristic work.
articles.lead_paragraph: BHUBANESWAR, India — Namita Pradhan sat at a desk in downtown Bhubaneswar, India, about 40 miles from the Bay of Bengal, staring at a video recorded in a hospital on the other side of the world.
